snippet: Critics say the new law could lead to imprisonment for simple activities like sharing Facebook and Twitter posts.
abstract: New Internet law takes effect in the Philippines, setting penalties for several computer-related crimes, including child pornography, identity theft, online fraud and illegally accessing computer networks; critics say law could lead to imprisonment for common activities like sharing Facebook and Twitter posts.
lead_paragraph: Critics say the new law could lead to imprisonment for simple activities like sharing Facebook and Twitter posts.

headline.seo: New Internet Law Gets Hostile Reception in Philippines
headline.main: Internet Law in Philippines Takes Effect, Raising Fears
headline.print_headline: Internet Law In Philippines Takes Effect, Raising Fears
